title: Reach Speech: Speech therapy for kids and babies
description:
Hello, dear parent, nanny, speech therapist!
This game is a unique technique based on the natural stages of the child‚Äôs speech development. Experts in speech therapy and pedagogy put their hearts into this game, and their experience will help your kid to learn some speech skills necessary for speech launch.

- Developed by an experienced speech therapist, specializing in launching speech in non-verbal children
- The app is useful for children with dysarthria or apraxia of speech
- Successfully tested
- Invokes interest for active speech in small kids
- Includes tasks for phonemic awareness, tempo and rhythm of speech, vocalization skills, repetition of syllables, onomatopoeia and words, the construction of the first phrases.
- Contains detailed instructions for parents and teachers in each section
- Based on the principle of gradual complication of speech material
- Designed for speech development of children from 18 months 
- Suitable both for kids with regular speech development as well as speech disorders

recentChanges: Optimized app size
comments: I think it's a good app. Am helping my 25 month old son with two word phrases but the "my friend let's play" and "now you" phrases are confusing to him. Instead of repeating the action phrase in the picture his repeating the "now you" phrase which is in every picture phrase ü§£. I wish I could turn them off because it's confusing and doesn't help because that's more than two words
I have purchased the full version, but I can not open on other devices or profiles on devices. I sent a email, hopefully they will fix this or refund my money.
Perfect for my 3yr old who still doesnt speak but is undergoing medical assistance.
It is really crashing now and I do not know why it is so? ,
I bought the full version and it still has everything locked don't waste your time this app has no one working on it

title: Speech Blubs: Language Therapy
description:
Do you need more proof? Check out the featured stories on Speech Blubs in Thrive Magazine, Autism Parenting, Brisbane Kids, Speech Chick Therapy, Beautiful Speech Life, and The Speech Teacher. Speech Blubs was also honored by winning the Social Impact award and is supported by Facebook‚Äôs Start Program.

This voice-controlled speech therapy app is designed to help kids learn new sounds and words, and to practice speaking in a stimulating, educational environment. We are proud, though a bit flabbergasted that our 1500+ activities have been used over 1,000,000 times to trigger sound and word production in toddlers, late talkers (speech delay), children with Apraxia of Speech, Autism, Down Syndrome, ADHD, and Sensory Processing Disorder.


WHY SHOULD YOU TRUST SPEECH BLUBS?

Jennifer Marron, B.S., SLP-A
I use Speech Blubs with my articulation students who have a difficult time using their lips and tongue to produce certain sounds (e.g. /b/, /p/, /th/, /l/, etc.). The clients I have used this to have so far loved it and are fully engaged. Thank you for a great application!

If that doesn‚Äôt give you confidence, you should also know that Speech Blubs
- Uses scientifically proven video modeling for effective speech development
- Has over 1500+ exercises, activities, funny hats, videos, mini-games, and more!
- Releases brand new, exciting content every week!
- Uses 25 fun activity themes ‚Äì Early Sounds, When I Grow Up, Get into Shapes, Living Colors, This Is My Body, Mouth Gym, Animal Kingdom, Ride Your Wheels, Sing Along, Guess the Word, Guess the Sound, NUMB3R5, and many more!
- Has voice-activated functionality that provides a fun, interactive learning experience
- Makes fun use of special effects like funny hats and masks in real time using facial detection
- Lets you collect stickers and fill your sticker book as your child progresses
- Provides funny and educational content designed to trigger conversation

Try Speech Blubs activities for FREE!

SCIENTIFICALLY-PROVEN LEARNING TECHNIQUES
In a recent study published by the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association (ASHA), UCLA researchers proved that watching peers in real time results in MIRROR NEURONS being activated, which has been shown to be highly effective in speech development. Speech Blubs uses video modeling to create an immersive learning environment that allows children to observe their peers on video as they learn. 

NEW, REGULARLY RELEASED CONTENT!
Finally, a rare app that parents won‚Äôt mind their kids becoming absorbed in, one that provides a nearly endless supply of content for your children to enjoy, including over 1500 activities, exercises, funny hats and masks, effects, videos, mini-games, and more! Our team is always working hard to add exciting new content each and every week!

SUBSCRIPTION, PRICING & TERMS
Start with a 7-day free trial, get access to unlocked content and test out the app. To subscribe (and keep access to all the practices), you will be charged your monthly or annual subscription fee through your GooglePlay account. A recurring transaction, that will automatically renew unless you cancel your account at least 24 hours before the end of the current subscription month. You can manage your subscription, cancel anytime, or turn off auto-renewal by accessing your GooglePlay account. Any unused portion of a free trial period will be forfeited when you subscribe.

Read our full Terms & Conditions and Privacy Policy here: https://speechblubs.com/legal/privacy-policy-for-applications/

summary: Speech Therapy For Kids!
developerAddress: 3500 South DuPont Highway, Dover, County of Kent, Delaware 19901
recentChanges:
Nothing major, just some cool new mechanics for building sentences. Oh, and we also incorporated the 3 Fs: it's more fun, faster, and full of want-to-use-it-everyday kind of content!

And while you‚Äôre here‚Ä¶ we are always happy to hear from you at hi@blubblub.org
comments: We've been trying for a while, but my 2.5 year old is not interested in trying to repeat the words. I'll likely cancel after the first year. Suggestion for the app developers: In the activities where the kids are teaching a new word, you should add a picture of the item in the corner of the screen while the kids say it. Otherwise they hear the word pronunciation over and over without getting the association to the meaning. EDIT: Yes, we sit with him using it and try to make it fun for him.

Kept seeing ads for this, so I downloaded it! Started the free trial before I decided to buy a subscription, and so glad I did! I couldn't even get a single activity done. There was no sound, the screen kept freezing and the app keeps force closing. Waste of time.

If I could give it a zero I really would as I should've read the reviews first before purchasing. This App is an absolute disaster, waste of time energy and money. I paid for the free trial and the available activities for my 24 month old son to use are so limited with only one activity in each section. I am trying to cancel subscription after ten mins of use its proving to be a headache and not that simple. Can someone pls advise and instruct me on how to cancel subscription ASAP pls. Thanks

On android you do have child lock like you do on iOS, also when it comes to pressing the buttons on the screen the entire screen is active so of my son holds the device with his left thumb on the screen he can't complete the actions like skip forward it take a photo as it doesn't use multi touch. Such a shame that they add these to iOS but not Android.
My 3 year old lost interest quick. Only part she liked was the photo filters.

title: Otsimo | Speech and Language Therapy SLP
description:
Otsimo | Speech Therapy Pronunciation Articulation is proud to be the only Speech Therapy app that uses voice and speech recognition technology and machine learning; it understands exactly what you are trying to say! 

For those who experience speech related issues such as:
- Delayed speech (late talkers),
- Non-verbal autism and down syndrome affecting speech,
- Difficulty to articulate themselves and enunciate,
- Apraxia,
 -Aphasia,
- Stuttering
- Articulation issues,
Can use Otsimo | Speech Therapy Pronunciation Articulation for speech practice efforts and improving their speech. 

The speech games designed specifically for individuals, are created under the guidance of parents, speech language pathologists (SLPs), and therapeutic activity experts. The assistive games in Otsimo | Speech Therapy Pronunciation Articulation aim to improve speech and communication skills.

All the reasons to try out Otsimo | Speech Therapy:
- We use voice and speech recognition technology to evaluate what is being said for accurate results, enhancing the speech therapy experience.
- With receptive, machine learning technology, the app detects whether or not the articulation and pronunciation is being improved.
- Each speech exercise is followed by funny filters, with hats and masks as rewards, to make learning more fun.
- Each speech exercise also has 200+ stickers to be collected, encouraging the individual to be more engaged with the speech therapy.

The exercises involve repetition, a popular method of aba speech therapy, which helps with the development of the person with speech impediments. As part of certified professional therapy, we use video modelling that enables learning from peers through mimicking.

Our apps are updated on a weekly basis with exciting content and speech activities, so you never get bored of learning new words.

For purposes of learning and development, Otsimo | Speech Therapy Pronunciation Articulation will teach how to articulate the correct sound of vowels and consonants and more, so they can learn to communicate orally in an improved way.

Otsimo | Speech Therapy Pronunciation Articulation is a pocket SLP that you can use as speech therapy at home. Awarded as the best therapy activities app, it aims to reduce any kind of language and speech problems, in a fun way!

The Otsimo | Speech Therapy app consists of more than 10 categories, including Basic Shapes, Body Parts, Safari Club, Tongue Acrobacy, Rainbow Splash! Each category stimulates sound production from the individual, and sets vocabulary goals.

Otsimo | Speech Therapy Pronunciation Articulation journey starts with 7-days free trial or monthly subscription. Offered subscription types are monthly subscription with $6.99/month, annual subscription with the projection of $3.49 / month and Lifetime with $119.99. Actual charges might be converted to local currency depending on your country of residence. We guarantee that the conversion will be made automatically. Once the purchase is completed, payment will be charged to your Google Play account at confirmation of purchase. 

Subscriptions automatically renew unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current subscription period. Our account will be charged for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current period, and the cost of the renewal will be identified. Subscriptions may be managed by the user. Auto-renewal may be turned off by going to the user‚Äôs Account Settings after purchase. Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user purchases a subscription to that publication. 

Disclaimer: Otsimo | Speech Therapy Pronunciation Articulation is developed in a way that can be used with a guardian. Any individual can benefit from the service without any age restriction. 

For more information: 
Privacy Policy & Terms of Use - https://otsimo.com/legal/privacy-en.html 
Payment Policy - https://otsimo.com/legal/payment.html

recentChanges: Performance improvements and bug fixes.
comments: Horrible decided to try this for my son. It just freezes won't scroll can't do anything now I can't even cancel my subscription.
Our speech therapist suggested this and we‚Äôve been seeing the improvements. My son gained confidence as he practiced everyday. It‚Äôs easier to communicate with him now.
Still charged me an annual subscription even after I cancelled the free trial

It is a good app but I am upset because I was charged for months after the trial ended. I thought I had canceled the subscription on the app itself. When I finally realized I was being charged $37 US per month I figured out how to canc it through Google but was told there is a no refund policy. I did not use the app after the trial period and think I should get my money back. Apps make it easy to use but difficult if you are trying to unsubscribe or cancel.

I believe the best feature of this help is the videos of kids are actually kids. They don‚Äôt sound bossy as an adult would seem to a kid with autism. Since they‚Äôre peers to my daughter, she gets encouraged to imitate them and learn from them. We‚Äôve seen the improvement in weeks. She sounds better day by day and the app is obviously beneficial but also fun at the same time enough to keep her focused without feeling like lectured.

title: Speech Therapy Articulation App 1 (UK)
description:
www.speech-therapy-apps.co.uk 
YouTube video
 https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtsTBfKOs_sgzu06K9CceFg 
This App is designed for children and adults with speech sound difficulties who are receiving Speech and Language Therapy. It is a great way to practice sounds which have been targeted by the Speech Therapist.  The app is full of engaging pictures, fun exercises and games.  This encourages practice and results in better progress with speech.
 https://www.facebook.com/pg/speech.therapy.apps/photos/ 

The Speech Therapy app was developed in collaboration with Kate Biss, Speech and Language Therapist. (http://katebiss-speechtherapist.co.uk) 

Speech therapy articulation app 1
- contains 7 sounds ( b,d,f,g,h,ch, j)
- 485 words
- price for all sounds is 5.49 GBP  

Speech therapy articulation app 2
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.pmqsoftware.speech.therapy.uk2 
- contains 7 speech sounds (k, l, m, n, ng, p, r)
- 545  words
- price for all sounds is 5.49 GBP  

Speech therapy articulation app 3
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.pmqsoftware.speech.therapy.uk3 
- contains 10 speech sounds (s, sh, t, th, the, v, w, y, z, zh)
- 478 words
- price for all sounds is 5.49 GBP  

Speech therapy app for children: articulation and pronunciation exercises. The App can also be used with adults to work on articulation, speech and memory.

Speech and Language Therapists will find a selection of vocabulary which progresses in levels of complexity.  The target words are carefully selected to represent differences in word position, sound complexity and word structure.  The app also features a useful ‚Äòrepeat and record‚Äô facility.

The App contains interesting photographs and illustrations across a variety of topics.  The pictures include common objects, nouns, action words and describing words.  These are an excellent resource to support vocabulary development.

Remarks:
-  These exercises cannot replace therapy sessions with a Speech Therapist. Using the app helps with daily home practice, making practice fun and motivating.  It is important for a family member to be present and support the child with their practice.

-   Before starting these exercises, clients must be able to produce the sound in isolation and in simple syllables.  The exercises and games will help to develop the use of the sound in more complicated words.

-    If you are not sure what to do, check with your Speech Therapist.

The app is really good expecially for speech therapy session. There are lot of rhyming words that can be used
I had hoped for letter groups which my friend wanted help to practice ...ltrbs otherwise app seems excellent. Thank you! It is not for me personally.
Helping my Dad . With his speach. After his Stroke. 83 years old. Taught him how to easily Open Cell. Use tools. Thank you. Worth every penny.
This is a very good app

title: SpeakEasy: Home Speech Therapy
description:
Boost your child's language development at home!

We believe there's a speech and language expert in every home: YOU. We empower you with evidence-based, fun activities and effective teaching techniques, written by a speech therapist. Join over 2000 parents and caregivers to get language, delivered daily.

‚≠êOver 2000 caregivers AND over 2000 speech therapists trust us‚≠ê

üí¨For caregivers of early language learners with or without speech delay, with a special version of the app for SLPs

SpeakEasy is built for early childhood language development. We like to think in stage, rather than age: this app is for you if your child is preverbal, using first words, combining words, or using full sentences. 

We're here for all caregivers who want to focus on the speech and language development of their child, whether or not they have a speech delay or are currently receiving therapy.

If you're an SLP or other early childhood professional, we've got a special version of the app for you too.


üè†At home language learning

Young children spend most of their time at home with their family. That's why all speech language pathologists (SLPs) know the best place to learn language is in the comfort of your home.

We're founded by an SLP, and more than 2000 SLPs trust our content. That's why we're working with SLPs as a complement to their services, to help teach you exactly how to boost your own child's language development.


üéØCustomized to your child: start your Personalized Language Journey

Language learning is a journey. Our guided experience will take you step by step through your child's own Personalized Language Journey based on the needs of you and your early talker.


üßëCaregiver focused: you become the speech and language expert

While screens have a time and place in every home, we believe when caregivers like you interact directly with your child, you have the biggest impact on their education and development. That's why our app is focused on empowering the caregiver, and why we don't have an app where you hand your phone over to your child.


üìèSkills Tracker, Learning Labs, Routines, and more

Beyond fun activities, effective teaching techniques, and a Personalized Language Journey, we have many more features to help you and your child communicate more often and more effectively.
-Know exactly what you should be working on with your child at their language development stage with personalized goals.
-Track your child's development with the SpeakEasy Skills Tracker.
-Do activities as part of your existing routines, including playtime, mealtime, bathtime, bedtime, and seasonal specials.
-Read hot speech and language development topics in Learning Labs: "Does being bilingual cause speech delay?" - "How much screen time is too much?"
-And more!


üì±How does the app work exactly?

1. Receive daily activities that teach you language learning techniques
2. Do activities during your existing routines
3. Earn points, level up, and unlock new stuff
4. Advanced on your child's Language Journey


üÜìStart a free trial of SpeakEasy Unlimited!

SpeakEasy Unlimited unlocks a ton of activities, language-teaching techniques, speech and language articles, child progress tracking, and more. Start with a free trial! 


‚≠êDownload now!‚≠ê

comments: Great, simple and fun activities to build in to your day to help bring on language. Even our smallest little boy is getting lots out of it. App runs a little slow but it's worth a bit of patience
I wish I had found this app earlier! It has a lot of good suggestions for fun activities to practice speech skills with my daughter. Sometimes it does take a while to open, but it works eventually.

I love how fun, engaging, and bite-sized each daily activity is! I feel like I'm learning as much as the kids are, so thanks for teaching me some new tricks and making an app that's so easy to use and developmentally appropriate. Highly recommend!
its an amazing app.. absolutely love it !! it gives you so many activities and ideas that you can try with your child. I wish I had found this earlier.

This app is great for suggesting activities I can do with my 7 month old. I wanted to encourage learning and wasn't quite sure where to start. This app makes it all very easy and fun. Plus, it is nice to have around when I'm out of ideas to keep her busy!

title: Language and Cognitive Therapy for Children (MITA)
description:
‚Ä¢ THE FIRST AND ONLY LANGUAGE THERAPY APPLICATION SUPPORTED BY CLINICAL DATA: 
In a 3-year clinical trial of 8,766 children with autism, young children who trained with MITA improved their language score at the end of the trial on average 3-times more than similar children who did not use MITA. See results at ClinicalTrials.gov/ct2/show/results/NCT02708290. 

‚Ä¢ Includes unlimited language and cognitive exercises designed to last for 10 years

‚Ä¢ Used by over 1,000,000 children with language delay

‚Ä¢ Best Autism App on the Healthline‚Äôs list

‚Ä¢ Available in English, Spanish, Portuguese, Russian, German, French, Italian, Arabic, Farsi, and Chinese.

Mental Imagery Therapy for Autism (MITA) is a unique, early-intervention application for children with language delay and autism. MITA trains mental integration and language, starting with simple vocabulary, and progressing towards higher forms of language, such as adjectives, verbs, pronouns, and syntax.


MITA EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES

‚Ä¢ Based on ABA techniques of visual-visual and auditory-visual conditional discrimination.
‚Ä¢ Based on language therapy technique of following directions with increasing complexity.
‚Ä¢ Based on Pivotal Response Treatment that targets development of response to multiple cues. 
‚Ä¢ Each activity is adaptive and delivers exercises that are at the exact level of difficulty appropriate for your child at any given point in time
‚Ä¢ Identify colors, patterns and sizes
‚Ä¢ Integrate objects into a unified picture
‚Ä¢ Spatial Prepositions: on/under/behind/in front
‚Ä¢ Time prepositions: Before/After
‚Ä¢ Passive verb tense
‚Ä¢ Subject / Object
‚Ä¢ Reading and Writing
‚Ä¢ Numbers and counting
‚Ä¢ Arithmetic
‚Ä¢ Logic and reasoning
‚Ä¢ Mental perspective taking
‚Ä¢ Mental mathematics
‚Ä¢ Playtime rewards will keep your child engaged while learning and having fun
‚Ä¢ No Wi-Fi necessary
‚Ä¢ No ads

MITA develops your child‚Äôs imagination and language functions. The visual exercises follow a systematic approach for developing your child's ability to notice multiple features of an object. MITA starts with simple exercises that teach your child to attend to only one feature, such as size (screenshot  #1) or color (#2). Over time, the exercises get more difficult and require your child to attend to two features simultaneously, such as both color and size (#3). Once your child has practiced attending to two features, the program moves on to puzzles that require attending to three features, such as color, size and shape (#4), and then eventually to puzzles that involve attending to an ever-increasing number of characteristics. 
The verbal exercises offer a more conventional approach to language acquisition, starting with simple vocabulary, and progressing towards higher forms of language, such as adjectives, prepositions, and syntax.
MITA is designed for early childhood and intended for long-term, daily use. It is engaging and educational, as well as adaptive and responsive to the individual abilities of each child. MITA exercises can be used by children with language delay, ASD, PDD, intellectual and developmental disability (IDD), Down syndrome, and other neurodevelopmental disorders as a supplement to conventional speech therapy.

MITA is developed by Dr. A. Vyshedskiy, a neuroscientist from Boston University; R. Dunn, a Harvard-educated early-child-development specialist; MIT-educated, J. Elgart and a group of award-winning artists and developers working alongside experienced therapists.

MITA in the news: https://youtu.be/giZymh3rMHc
MITA research articles: http://imagiration.com/research/

recentChanges:
‚Ä¢ THE FIRST AND ONLY LANGUAGE THERAPY APPLICATION SUPPORTED BY CLINICAL DATA:
In a 3-year clinical trial of 6,454 children with autism, language score in children who engaged with MITA has increased to levels, which were 70% higher than in children with similar initial evaluations. comments: Very good game! Thus, for language it is important 1. To decrease delays between trials - they wre very long and a child loses attention, while in language teavhing procedure speed is a vital clue. 2. It is important before changing the "level" to verify that a word is really remembered. I have to change a level back manually at each session, because I am sure that my child does not remember a name of an object, but got the program algoryth using visual clues.
My child using it for 10 months and his improvement is really grate. Very useful app for autistic child like my son.
My 3 year loves using this app. It has definitely helped us.
It helps my 6 year old. Great app.. üëçAfter a few months of use, the challenge is keeping him interested as he now rejects doing this... For variety, can pictures change? Like plants? Thanks..

4 stars as a start. As the parent of a Autistic child, your "app" is challenging, easy to comprehend by the child, fast, with continuous flow of activities per letters.. THANKS, for this DEVZ. More power to you, & GOD bless you!!

title: HelpMeTalk
description:
HelpMeTalk is help to improve the Speech capabilities of people with speech and language disorders who are receiving Speech Therapy. This app is full of engaging pictures, interesting animation, voices and effective exercises. This encourages practice and results in better progress with speech.

List of features:
‚úî Support multi language and voices.
‚úî Support animation (GIF) beside choosing from device, you can make your own animation by taking video.
‚úî Effective exercise for learn to talk with using speech recognition.
‚úî Customise pictures by choosing from device or taking new photos.
‚úî Customise voices by changing language setting or record your own voices.
‚úî Able to adjust the vocal pitch and speech rate.

Suitable for:
‚Ä¢ autism symptoms and Asperger syndrome, autistic spectrum disorder (ASD)
‚Ä¢ aphasia
‚Ä¢ speech apraxia
‚Ä¢ articulation/phonological disorder
‚Ä¢ Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS)

‚Ä¢ down syndrome

Please rate us if you like this app and share with others who need help.

comments: I like the app a lot since I'm a speech therapist my self. But there's only one downside. I made the donation and got full access, but after I record my voice when I play it back it sounds like cracking, breaking.... it's not a good recording feature. Also, the app keeps crashing and stopping out of the blue. Does it has unresolved bugs? Please, I want my contribution to matter. Thanks

Most stupid app ever seen. This app doesn't deserve one star. Its a waste of time and data. After downloading 47mb, it still want me to connect to internet before it works. Even with the internet connection it keeps saying cannot connect to the server.

Nice app. Paid the subscription for the full version and found it easy enough to record audio and pictures. Big issue though is that it needs internet access to open the app. Big turn off not being able to use the app at all in offline mode. If this was fixed would consider reinstalling and updating the score.

This helps my son learn to say words by attaching a picture and hearing it say that word. I had trouble getting it to work at first, but after contacting the developer, they helped me fix that problem. Thanks!
Since I've shown my son this app, he opens the app and goes through the menu and attempts repeats the words by himself, without me having to sit and practice with him. Really easy for him to use.

title: Speech Pathology Tools
description:
Main aims: 
- Increasing educational chances of children with speech difficulties by creating a free pre-assessment mechanism for use by teachers at nursery and primary schools.
- Intervening at the earliest stages of speech development with Free appropriate language support and therapy tools and materials.
- Helping children to fully benefit from education with a Free mobile tool that includes assessment and practical exercises.

The app enables use of an age based test to assess a child's Speech Skills.
- It contains a set of flashcards, to work on sounds and positions.
- It contains worksheets to use with a child on specific sounds in specific word positions.
- It presents useful information on expected progress by age.

Features:
The app is completely free and is available for the following languages:
- English
- Bulgarian
- Serbian
- Dutch
- Slovenian
- Turkish

Target groups: 
- Nursery and primary school teachers
- Speech and language therapists
- Special education teachers / Special educational needs coordinators
- Children with speech and communication needs
- Parents of children with speech and communication needs

The app was co-funded by the ERASMUS + programme of the European Union.

IMPORTANT: This app is not intended to replace a professional speech and language therapist. Any speech issues detected should be referred to a professional speech and language therapist before any interventions are implemented. Misuse of the app has the potential to cause harm to the child's speech development.

The European Commission support for the production of this app does not constitute an endorsement of the contents which reflects the views only of the authors, and the Commission cannot be held responsible for any use which may be made of the information contained therein.

title: Leeloo AAC - Autism Speech App for Nonverbal Kids
description:
Leeloo is an app that helps non-verbal kids to communicate with their parents, teachers and friends. Leeloo is developed with the AAC (Augmentative and Alternative Communication) and PECS (Picture Exchange Communication System) principles. Which is strong techniques for autism treatment and autism therapy in communication.

In this app, there is a card for every word that your kid might need to use in daily. And every card is matched with an definitive vector image about the phrase or word your kid trying to communicate.

Leeloo also has voice capability. Every card pressed will reveal options of phrases, and the chosen phrase will be read by a text-to-speech robot.

Leeloo designed for kids suffering mental, learning or behaviour disorders mostly Autism and is suitable for but not limited to; 
- Aspergers syndrome
- Angelman syndrome
- Down syndrome
- Aphasia
- Speech apraxia
- ALS
- MDN
- Cerebral pally

Leeloo has pre-configured and tested cards for preschool and currently attending school kids. But can be costimazed for an adult or a later age person who is suffering similar disorders or in the spectrum mentioned.

See our open source project: https://github.com/btk/aac-native

We look forward to your feedback, PLEASE take your time to add your comment with your app review.

title: Otsimo | Special Education Autism Learning Games
description:
Otsimo Special Education enables the individuals to engage their motor and cognitive skills through assistive matching, drawing, choosing, ordering and sound games. 

For individuals or children who struggle with speech and language, Otsimo includes free AAC (Alternative and Augmentative Communication). It is a common practice that is used in speech therapy and special education schools. AAC allows the individual to communicate their thoughts and emotions to their friends and family.

Otsimo games are developed according to the Applied Behavior Analysis - ABA therapy which is the most widely known and trusted early intensive behavioral therapy technique for helping individuals who have learning disorders and attention deficit problems.

Otsimo Special Education gives you plenty of reasons to try the games out:

A learning path feature, that is ideal for children learning new skills. The app provides a path of exercises depending on the level of progress.Featured for more than 250 days! Otsimo is a certified and awarded educational game application developed for individuals diagnosed with learning disorders, attention deficit, autism, down syndrome, aspergers, and other special needs.

Created under the guidance of parents, psychologists and special education teachers; assistive games in Otsimo teach fundamental education and concepts about core skills such as:

- Vocabulary and words,
- Numbers,
- Emotions,
- Colors,
- Music
- Animals,
- Vehicles and more.


Homeschool category that gives you all the exercises ideal for early education at the comfort of your home.
Game and difficulty settings are completely customizable depending on performance levels.
Otsimo Special Education follows a strict no-ads policy preventing any kind of intrusion and unwanted disturbance.
Parents can have access to detailed report cards that give insight into performance and progress rates.
Can be used by individuals having Autism spectrum disorder, down syndrome, asperger‚Äôs, ADHD, cerebral palsy, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, motor neuron disease (MND), speech impediments, and aphasia.


Otsimo Premium

Otsimo is free to use, but you can access more educational games and features by upgrading to premium. 

Otsimo Premium offers you:
- Access to all 100+ educational games
- 2 new games every month
- Personalized special education
- In-depth insights to track the progress 
- Daily and weekly report cards about the played games
- Cross-platform support up-to 3 devices

For Otsimo Premium, we offer the following subscriptions:

1 month from $20.99
1 year with discount from $9.99/month
1 year from $13.75/monthly
LifeTime from $299.99

Actual charges might be converted to local currency depending on your country of residence. We guarantee that the conversion will be made automatically. 

If you upgrade to Otsimo Premium, payment will be charged to your Play account at confirmation of purchase.
Subscription automatically renews unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24 hours before the end of the current period.
Account will be charged for renewal within 24 hours of the end of the current period, and the cost of the renewal will be provided.
Subscriptions may be managed by the user. Auto-renewal may be turned off by going to the user‚Äôs Account Settings after purchase.
Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user purchases a subscription to that publication.

For more information:
Privacy Policy & Terms of Use - https://otsimo.com/legal/privacy-en.html
Payment Policy - https://otsimo.com/legal/payment.html

My kid no longer uses it and I want a refund.
It's great app for special child..but it's much costy to compare to other apps.if a possible prodive some more discount for monthly payment.....
This program is absolutely amazing. I swear they have to be hypnotizing or drugging my little guy the way he calms down excitedly when its otsimo time..ü§î Im gonna need to get a lifetime license

I really wanted this to work! Unfortunately, on my Lenovo Chromebook it does not. It looks like an awesome app though and has won awards. UPDATE: Thanks Otsimo for your response! Usually there is a message on my chromebook that tells me an app is not compatible. it is not fair to give a 1 star rating for an app that is not available for chromebooks so I am changing to a 4 star for great customer response. If you label your app as not available for chromebooks I will raise it even higher.

You are cheating people out of their money. I was within the trial period when I cancelled my subscription from the app. And to my surprise money still got deducted from my account.And when I wrote email to your support team they said I need to get in touch with google pay and in most cases they won't refund the money. I really don't care if google pay did it or something else... I cancelled my subscription from your app within the trail period. So return my money. People beware don't fall prey.

title: Speech Assistant AAC
description:
Speech Assistant AAC is a Text to Speech (TTS) app designed for people who are speech impaired, for example due to Aphasia, MND/ALS, Autism, Stroke, Cerebral Palsy or other speech problems.

With the app you can create categories and phrases, which are placed on buttons. With these buttons you can create messages that can be shown or spoken (text-to-speech). It is also possible to type any text using the keyboard.
The app is easy to use and can be completely customized to your needs and preferences.

For all devices
‚Ä¢ The app is available for smartphones and tablets.
‚Ä¢ Portrait and landscape layout for all devices.

Categories and phrases
‚Ä¢ Add, change or delete your own phrases. 
‚Ä¢ You can create categories to organize your phrases for quick access.
‚Ä¢ Long press (optional setting) to easily edit the phrase and category buttons.
‚Ä¢ Option to Backup and Restore your categories and phrases.

Fully Customizable
‚Ä¢ The size of the buttons, the textbox and the text can be adjusted.
‚Ä¢ The app has various color schemes and you can also create a personal color scheme.

Full screen
‚Ä¢ Show your message full screen with a very large font.
‚Ä¢ Useful for communicating in a noisy environment.

Other features
‚Ä¢ Connect a bluetooth keyboard and create shortcuts for the functions Speak, Clear and Show.
‚Ä¢ Button to share your message to mail, text and social media.
‚Ä¢ Option for preventing double tapping by disabling the button (for a short time) after touching.
‚Ä¢ Undo option in case of unintentionally tapping the clear button.
‚Ä¢ Button to make an attention sound.
   
Speech
The voice is not part of the app, but the app uses the voice that‚Äôs installed on your device. For instance the voices from Google Text-to-Speech. You can change the voice in the settings of your device. You can also download other voices from the Google Play Store.
   
Feedback and information
For feedback, questions, tips or problems, please contact: android@asoft.nl
Website: www.asoft.nl
   
Full version
In the settings of the app you can upgrade to the full version with additional features like more categories and phrases, customizable action buttons, pronunciation corrections and much more.

recentChanges:
- The color picker has more color choices.
- It is now possible to Backup / Restore from Google Drive.
comments: Found it outstanding, I have mnd and my voice has gone and and I am a techno phobe and found this easy to use, communication between me and my wife is far better now. This app is far superior to others I have tried.

This app is everything I never realized I needed!!! I am on the Autism spectrum, and my wife is too. We both go nonverbal sometimes. This makes it so much easier to communicate during those times. Wish I had this growing up!!! It's also fun to play with because we are immature lol. We made the male Google voice sound uncannily like Connor from Detroit: Become Human.
This thing has saved my butt when anxiety shuts down my ability to talk. It's easy to modify, and it doesn't feel like an AAC device for special needs, with extraneous pictures. Simple, easy to use.

Great app! It's very customizable and perfect for those who prefer text-based AAC apps. I even have different profiles with different setups and colors for my ease of use. This is simply great and flexible.
i love this. i have autism and sometimes go nonverbal in stressful situations, i love that i was able to program the phrases to be exactly what i want.

title: Silent Speech
description:
Caring for a child with special needs can demand a lot of energy and time. There may be days when you feel overwhelmed, stressed, or intimidated. Parenting isn‚Äôt ever easy, and raising a child with learning disability is even more challenging. Children who are non-verbal or not communicating well enough due to hearing loss, autism, apraxia, cerebral palsy, selective mutism etc, can use other techniques of communication like Sign language, Picture Exchange Communication System, Voice Output Communication Aids and Augmentative and Alternative Communication.

Stroke or cancer causes severe communication problems even in adults. Neurological disorders like Huntington‚Äôs disease and Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis can also cause difficulty in speaking. Silent speech is a high-tech aided system of Augmentative and Alternative Communication (AAC), in which a child converses by touching pictures on a mobile screen that voices for the child.

Silent speech has a wide range of pictures that a child would need to communicate in daily life. The paramount features are Early Bird, School, Hobbies, Bed Time and Diet that has images convenient for every day life. Another unique feature of this app is Touch, which has pictures of good touch, bad touch and bully which helps you safeguard your kids from any possible abuse in schools, public places, family gatherings or therapy sessions.

title: Speech Therapy Articulation App 2 (UK)
description:
www.speech-therapy-apps.co.uk 
YouTube video
 https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtsTBfKOs_sgzu06K9CceFg 
This App is designed for children and adults with speech sound difficulties who are receiving Speech Therapy. It is a great way to practice sounds which have been targeted by the Speech Therapist.  The app is full of engaging pictures, fun exercises and games.  This encourages practice and results in better progress with speech.
 https://www.facebook.com/pg/speech.therapy.apps/photos/ 

The Speech Therapy app was developed in collaboration with Kate Biss, Speech and Language Therapist. (http://katebiss-speechtherapist.co.uk) 

Speech therapy articulation app 1
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.pmqsoftware.speech.therapy.uk1 
- contains 7 sounds ( b,d,f,g,h,ch, j)
- 485 words
- price for all sounds is 5.49 GBP

Speech therapy articulation app 2
- contains 7 speech sounds (k, l, m, n, ng, p, r)
- 545  words
- price for all sounds is 5.49 GBP

Speech therapy articulation app 3
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.pmqsoftware.speech.therapy.uk3 
- contains 10 speech sounds (s, sh, t, th, the, v, w, y, z, zh)
- 478 words
- price for all sounds is 5.49 GBP 

Speech therapy app for children: articulation and pronunciation exercises. The App can also be used with adults to work on articulation, speech and memory.

Speech and Language Therapists will find a selection of vocabulary which progresses in levels of complexity.  The target words are carefully selected to represent differences in word position, sound complexity and word structure.  The app also features a useful ‚Äòrepeat and record‚Äô facility.

The App contains interesting photographs and illustrations across a variety of topics.  The pictures include common objects, nouns, action words and describing words.  These are an excellent resource to support vocabulary development.

Remarks:
-  These exercises cannot replace therapy sessions with a Speech Therapist. Using the app helps with daily home practice, making practice fun and motivating.  It is important for a family member to be present and support the child with their practice.

-   Before starting these exercises, clients must be able to produce the sound in isolation and in simple syllables.  The exercises and games will help to develop the use of the sound in more complicated words.

-    If you are not sure what to do, check with your Speech Therapist.

title: Speech Sounds Visualized
description:
Want to see exactly how English speech sounds are made? This unique tool allows you to see speech in action through x-ray and 3D animated videos! Simply select the sound you wish to visualize, then watch stunning x-ray videos accurately show how each sound is formed in the mouth. A great resource for use in speech therapy to assist with articulation and for English Language Learners for help with pronunciation. 

Created by a Speech Language Pathologist, a subscription to Speech Sounds Visualized includes numerous features designed to stimulate speech therapy progress:

‚Ä¢Toggle between 3D animations or x-ray images for all sounds in the English phonetic alphabet
‚Ä¢Sounds are organized into 3 sections: consonants, vowels, and the R-sound combinations
‚Ä¢Sounds can be viewed in the phonetic alphabet symbols if preferred
‚Ä¢Written instructions provided by a Speech Language Pathologist 
‚Ä¢Recording capability at the sound, word, and sentence levels
‚Ä¢Words and sentences that highlight each sound provided for extra practice
‚Ä¢Slow motion feature
‚Ä¢Zoom feature
‚Ä¢Customer service available directly through the App via click-through to email or social media
‚Ä¢No advertisements in order to facilitate learning without distraction
‚Ä¢Phonemes included: p,b,m,w,f,v,t,d,s,z,n,l,k,g,h,sh,zh,ng,y,j,ch,th, vowels, and all vocalic-r sounds

Subscription Details:

Monthly Subscription: Full access to Speech Sounds Visualized for one month. 

Annual Subscription: Full access to Speech Sounds Visualized for one year. 
Payment will be charged to your Google Play account at confirmation of purchase. 
Subscriptions automatically renew unless canceled within 24-hours before the end of the current period. You can cancel anytime or turn off auto-renew in your Google Play account settings. 

For more information, see our Terms of Service and our Privacy Policy: https://www.speechsoundsvisualized.org

recentChanges: Created by a Speech Language Pathologist, the Speech Sounds Visualized app increases engagement and learning by showing how sounds are formed through unique x-ray videos and animation!
comments: This app changed something for me, and the kids, today as I've been masked for all of my sessions with my current caseload. They've never gotten the proper visual feedback from me when sounds were said in error; they just got my very green attempt at audio feedback/direction (I'm a CFü•¥). I love the option to do a 3D visual and the animation. I'm just in awe and so glad to finally feel like I will be making a dent in my kids' goals with the help of this app. Thank you.

This app is phenomenal! The xray and animation combination makes it easy to see and understand what is happening with all the sounds. There is nothing else like this out there that I have been able to find. Highly recommend this.
Awesome app! Love the versatility and clear explanations of how sounds are formed.
This is a great app
Perfect

title: Conversation Therapy Lite
description:
Conversation Therapy gets people talking! Now you can try this professional speech therapy app to target higher-level expressive language, pragmatic, problem-solving & cognitive-communication goals for older children, teens and adults! 

This FREE trial gives you a small sample of what you can do with the FULL version of Conversation Therapy! Get full functionality with 1% of the total content in to see how it works.

With over 300 real photographs & 10 questions each, Conversation Therapy gives you 3000+ questions. Combine that with user profiles, group play, and customization, and you get an incredibly useful tool for therapy! There's also the option to get the questions in English, French, Spanish, German, Dutch, Portuguese, Italian, Finnish, Filipino or Zulu!

10 Question Prompts Include:
*Describe
*Define
*Remember
*Decide
*Feel
*Infer
*Predict
*Narrate (Story Starters)
*Evaluate
*Brainstorm

Perfect for Brain Injury, Stroke, early Alzheimer's Disease, Aphasia, Aspergers and other forms of Autism, AAC users, SLI, Life Skills for Special Needs, and Middle & High School language therapy and education. So many goals can be targeted: speech, language, and cognitive!

Set up user profiles with each user's goals for quick starts and score tracking. Use a guest profile to get going quickly. Email scores and professional reports. Play with up to 4 users in a group, scoring any user at any time.

Read each question aloud, or have clients practice reading, then discuss your answers. Scoring is available to track correct, incorrect, and cued/approximate responses. You can also customize each question, tailoring it for your clients or translating it into their language!

Even those with limited speech have opinions to share; use these opportunities to help find new ways of expressing complex thoughts ‚Äì the responses you get from this app are sure to surprise, impress, and illuminate strengths & weaknesses in your clients. The vivid pictures and interesting topics in this app will spark discussion, learning, and debate. These questions don't have "right" or "wrong" answers, but there are appropriate answers, well-formed responses, and clearly spoken replies that can be scored. 

Photo stimuli are sorted into 12 categories including:
*Safety & Problems (over 50 functional scenes in full version)
*Everyday Activities
*Health
*Money & Politics
*Arts & Culture
*Social Problems
*Family
& more!

No in-app purchases, no personal data collection, and outside links can be disabled. Content is sorted into child, teen, and adult age groups to limit more sensitive topics. There are no sensitive topics in the Lite version of this app.

Try Conversation Therapy Lite today to see what everyone is talking about!

Looking for something different in a speech therapy app? We offer a wide range to choose from. Get the right one for you at https://tactustherapy.com/find

title: Voxi Kids - Easy speech
description:
Language development & vocabulary practice exercises designed in collaboration with speech pathologist to help children, parents and speech therapists. Voxi Kids contributes to the improvement of attention, development of speaking and listening skills, corrects articulation and fluency, improves visual and auditory memory, observation and general knowledge.
Our app includes several types of professional exercises used in speech therapy, such as categorizations, colors and positions in space. Voxi Kids can thus be used for educational purposes by both parents and children, at home and in speech pathology practices as working tool.
Designed to be like a mobile game, our app‚Äôs exercises offer new knowledge in a fun and enjoyable manner. We rely on a ‚Äòlearning through play‚Äô approach throughout the game‚Äôs chapters.
Voxi Kids is primarily meant for
- children with speech impairments and issues of communication
- people struggling with hearing loss
- young children who may use it for language development
Ideal for preschoolers, but it can also be used by people of all ages.
Parents can access a graphical representation of their child‚Äôs progress in the app, including the time spent on each exercise or chapter so they can receive a full feedback on the usefulness of the app, as well as their child‚Äôs evolution.
Keep in mind, Voxi Kids is not meant to replace professional therapy, but to assist speech therapists in their activities and help children easily and conveniently exercise their language skills outside the practitioner‚Äôs office.
Take your personal speech therapy app along with you on your phone. Practice anytime and anywhere!

title: Visual Reading¬Æ ‚Äì special education
description:
Visual Reading¬Æ - special education (2012 - 2020) is a new generation educational platform for special education teachers and speech therapists.

It is based on scientifically approved methods of applied behavior analysis.

PRIMARY USE:

title: LetMeTalk: Free AAC Talker
description:
A free AAC talker app which supports communication in all areas of life and therefore providing a voice to everyone. LetMeTalk is donation financed.

LetMeTalk enables you to line up images in a meaningful way to read this row of images as a sentence. To line up images is known as AAC (Augmentative and Alternative Communication).

Problems to Install? Find solution at bit.ly/1p6zGW8

The image database of LetMeTalk contains more than 9,000 easy to understand images from ARASAAC (http://arasaac.org). Additionally, you can add existing images from the device or take new photos with the build in camera.

To use LetMeTalk, no internet connection or mobile contract is necessary. Therefore you can use LetMeTalk in almost any situation, like hospitals, nursing home or schools.

You can find LetMeTalk tutorials at http://letmetalk.info/support

Suitable for:
‚Ä¢ autism symptoms and Asperger syndrome, autistic spectrum disorder (ASD)
‚Ä¢ aphasia
‚Ä¢ speech apraxia
‚Ä¢ articulation/phonological disorder
‚Ä¢ Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS)
‚Ä¢ Motor Neuron Disease (MND)
‚Ä¢ cerebral palsy
‚Ä¢ down syndrome

Features:
‚úî more than 9,000 images from ARASAAC included
‚úî Used by Speech Language Pathologists (SLP)
‚úî voice support for images and sentences
‚úî unlimited creation of new categories and adding new images
‚úî pre configured for kids with autism spectrum disorder (ASD)
‚úî load / save your current profile (vocabulary)
‚úî keep several profiles on your devices and switch fast between them
‚úî share your profile easily with other devices
‚úî load new profiles from our forum directly within LetMeTalk
‚úî switch fast between 2 languages and use LetMeTalk as translator

‚úî supported languages: English, Spanish, French, Italian and German, Chinese, Portuguese, Brazilian Portuguese, Arabic, Russian, Polish, Bulgarian, Romanian, Galician, Catalan, Basque
‚úî voice, if used language is supported by installed text to speech engine

Download now!

comments: It's a great app. with core vocabulary! You can form sentences, edit/customize pages and pictures, add pages and pictures, and it's super easy to navigate! Anddd it's free!! I highly recommend this app!!

I'm too old to figure this out.... Need something that lets me use the keyboard to type and then read that out loud. Maybe have a library of phrase I've input.... Communication outside of my computer is too tedious no matter what.

This app has been a life-saver; we use it to support our communications with our child on the autistic spectrum. The app in itself has to be personalized, and it is NOT easy.. It is time-consuming to get the personalized images (although they have an extensive generic image bank) up, as well as the pronunciation you wish on specific names or words. And, it is nearly impossible to transfer a profile between android devices. Yes, the app could be better, and it is a shame there is no more technical support offered for it, but I am giving it five stars because it is free, and it has been a massive help to us. Thanks!

I found this yesterday and have been playing around with it-I have 18 years experience working for children who have execptionalities. This is a wonderful app for anybody who may need a voice at times but do not have professional supports in place yet. My son has found it easy to navigate and loves that I was able to personalize the labels. The only issue I've had so far pertains to rearranging the pictures, they didn't stay where I put them.

Trying numerous augmented communication apps for my daughter and this one was the closest to what she use to have on the ipad when the device died. Awesome app. Very easy to set up, a lot of setting options to customize for the needs of the individual and it does not matter how long she pushes the button, it will say the word. Speech can be a little odd but this app gives you the ability to use other voice apps to change the sound. After trying quite a few, this is the one which fit all my needs. Will be donating money to the developer as soon as I can. Great job and thank you so very much!

title: Speech Therapy Articulation App 3 (UK)
description:
www.speech-therapy-apps.co.uk 
YouTube video
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtsTBfKOs_sgzu06K9CceFg 
This App is designed for children and adults with speech sound difficulties who are receiving Speech Therapy. It is a great way to practice sounds which have been targeted by the Speech Therapist.  The app is full of engaging pictures, fun exercises and games.  This encourages practice and results in better progress with speech.
 https://www.facebook.com/pg/speech.therapy.apps/photos/ 

The Speech Therapy app was developed in collaboration with Kate Biss, Speech and Language Therapist. (http://katebiss-speechtherapist.co.uk) 

Speech therapy articulation app 1
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.pmqsoftware.speech.therapy.uk1 
- contains 7 sounds ( b,d,f,g,h,ch, j)
- 485 words
- price for all sounds is 5.49 GBP

Speech therapy articulation app 2
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.pmqsoftware.speech.therapy.uk2 
- contains 7 speech sounds (k, l, m, n, ng, p, r)
- 545  words
- price for all sounds is 5.49 GBP

Speech therapy articulation app 3
- contains 10 speech sounds (s, sh, t, th, the, v, w, y, z, zh)
- 478 words
- price for all sounds is 5.49 GBP 

Speech therapy app for children: articulation and pronunciation exercises. The App can also be used with adults to work on articulation, speech and memory.

Speech and Language Therapists will find a selection of vocabulary which progresses in levels of complexity.  The target words are carefully selected to represent differences in word position, sound complexity and word structure.  The app also features a useful ‚Äòrepeat and record‚Äô facility.

The App contains interesting photographs and illustrations across a variety of topics.  The pictures include common objects, nouns, action words and describing words.  These are an excellent resource to support vocabulary development.

Remarks:
-  These exercises cannot replace therapy sessions with a Speech Therapist. Using the app helps with daily home practice, making practice fun and motivating.  It is important for a family member to be present and support the child with their practice.

-   Before starting these exercises, clients must be able to produce the sound in isolation and in simple syllables.  The exercises and games will help to develop the use of the sound in more complicated words.

-    If you are not sure what to do, check with your Speech Therapist.

title: Constant Therapy
description:
Constant Therapy is an award-winning speech therapy app designed to help people cope with aphasia, dementia and other speech, language and cognitive disorders caused by stroke or traumatic brain injuries. To date, thousands of users have completed over 110 million exercises using Constant Therapy. 

BENEFITS

‚Ä¢        Practice speech, language, cognition, memory, reading, attention and comprehension skills anytime, anywhere
‚Ä¢        Choose your recovery goals and we‚Äôll deliver personalized tasks to help you get there
‚Ä¢        See your progress in real time on your performance dashboard
‚Ä¢        Access a library of evidence-based exercises developed by neuroscientists and clinicians 
‚Ä¢        Get the most out of Constant Therapy with one-on-one help from Customer Support specialists 
‚Ä¢        Try before you subscribe with a 2-week free trial
‚Ä¢        Pair the app with cognitive and speech therapy you‚Äôre already doing in the clinic (even add your clinician so they can monitor your progress)


The Science Behind Constant Therapy:

Constant Therapy was designed by scientists at Boston University, and has won awards from the American Stroke Association and AARP. The clinically-proven app is recommended by speech language pathologists, neurologists and occupational therapists.

In a recent study of post-stroke rehabilitation practices published in Frontiers in Neurology, outcomes were compared among 3,686 patients who used tablet-based therapy at home independently and those who completed the same therapy in a clinic under the guidance of a clinician. The study found tablet-based home users mastered skills in a shorter time and practiced therapy more frequently than clinic users. Nearly one third (29%) of users who made gains were 71 years old or more, and the oldest user was 97 years old.*

Using Constant Therapy

- Try before you subscribe with a free 14-day trial

- Users can choose from two subscription plans: $24.99 per month or $249.99 per year.

Contact Us

Email ‚Äì support@constanttherapy.com

Visit Online ‚Äì https://thelearningcorp.com/constant-therapy/

Privacy Policy ‚Äì https://thelearningcorp.com/privacy/

Terms of Use ‚Äì https://thelearningcorp.com/eula/


* Study published in Frontiers in Neurology, ‚ÄúComparison of Therapy Practice at Home and in the Clinic: A Retrospective Analysis of the Constant Therapy Platform Data Set,‚Äù may be found at: https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fneur.2019.00140/full

** Constant Therapy does not provide rehabilitation services and does not guarantee improvements in brain function. Constant Therapy provides tools for self-help and tools for patients to work with their clinicians

recentChanges: More streamlined therapy experience, several bug fixes and performance improvements.
comments: Problems for people with dimentia or Alzheimers... It is NOT appropriate to ask them how well they are remembering things, understanding things, etc.as this app does with the user. Do not do that! It's embarrasing and very upsetting to people with those conditions to be asked those questions. If someone is using it with them, that person can answer those questions for them if it can be done without their hearing or seeing the questions. It is a good idea for someoneto do the exercises with them.

Went thru the baseline activities. Then was asked if I wanted to subscribe. Since I had no info on what subscription would entitle me to, plus no idea how much it would cost, I chose subscribe. But the page wouldn't load. Waited about 3 mins then X'd out of the app. I believe the app could help me, but I'm most likely out of the game because I'm on a very tight fixed income (disability).

great idea. not edited properly. I have went through multiple questions and there are multiple correct answers, however if you do not guess the CT APP correct answer your answer is deamed wrong. Even simple ones where you have to identify the symbols. There were 5 symbols, but it only lets you mark 4 of them. Good idea, poor follow through. Or you have to say the name of the picture, the picture is of a persons legs at a beach. If you say beach it us wrong because they are looking for LEG.

I have been looking for an app like this for a few years. Paid $2000 out of pocket to get all my strengths and weakness after multiple TBI's. After you register, you find out, you can only use it for15 days, then have to get a note from a doctor to use it, and pay them. I don' t mind paying for an app to help me. Getting a doctor note, when you are on a fixed income, w/o insurance is what I object to. If I ready needed a doctor I get a nice cash only based rate, but this is not neccessary.

Was excited to find something to improve my cognitive abilities, then I read the "about game" and found the app is free for 15 days, then you have to pay $25 a month, or $250 a year, or $350 for 2 years!!! I have been out of work since having a stroke (4 months). I can't afford $25 a month when I'm struggling to pay my electric bill, have already terminated the TV, phone is next to cut. App is free only for therapists and those working in the medical field. DON'T INSTALL. WASTE OF TIME.

title: PictoBoard: Help talk, Autism, Language, Therapy
description:
PictoBoard - is an app intended to improve the speech capabilities of people with speech and language disorders who are receiving speech therapy. 

PictoBoard is a very customizable app that allows you to record your own audios, create your own animations, set up your own pictograms and photos. it also has a good user experience interface to keep user attention. 

List of features:
‚úÖ   You can add youtube videos.
‚úÖ   You can add offline videos.
‚úÖ   Speech to see video challenge.
‚úÖ   Support multi-language.
‚úÖ   Search by voice.
‚úÖ   Listen and repeat.
‚úÖ   Customizable celebration audios.
‚úÖ   Customizable words to check pronunciation.
‚úÖ  Support animation (GIF) besides choosing from the device, you can make your own animation by taking or choosing videos.
‚úÖ  Customize pictures by choosing from the device or taking new photos.
‚úÖ  Customize audios by choosing from devices or record your own audios.
‚úÖ  Customize the text to speech selecting a language, pitch, and speech rate.
‚úÖ  Export and import all your data to share with other people or devices, you can download pictograms posted on our Facebook page and import them.
‚úÖ  Customizable options like repeat audio infinitely or only a specified number of times, close opened pictogram automatically, enable/disable user experience animations, set up a master password.

Suitable for:
‚úÖ  Autism symptoms and Asperger syndrome, autistic spectrum disorder (ASD).
‚úÖ  Aphasia.
‚úÖ  Speech apraxia.
‚úÖ  Articulation/phonological disorder.
‚úÖ  Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS).
‚úÖ  Motor Neuron Disease (MND).
‚úÖ  Cerebral palsy.
‚úÖ  Down syndrome

title: Spoken - Tap to Talk AAC
description:
Spoken is the natural language assistant for people with aphasia, autism, and other speech and language disorders. It‚Äôs an entirely new kind of augmentative and alternative communication that predicts the words you want next. You build real sentences quickly on your phone or tablet, and Spoken speaks them automatically.


‚Ä¢  Speak in sentences

You're not limited to simple phrases and icons. Every word you select brings up the words you‚Äôre likely to want next. Your thoughts turn into meaningful sentences as fast as you can tap.


‚Ä¢  Spoken learns your style

Everybody‚Äôs got their own way of talking. Spoken learns yours. The more you use it, the better it gets at predicting what you want to say. Express yourself more quickly and more fully with intelligent predictive language.


‚Ä¢  Spoken is Easy

Spoken is made for your tablet and phone. No new devices. No confusing menus. Spoken understands and predicts what you want to say next. You tap. Spoken talks. It‚Äôs that easy.


‚Ä¢  An innovative new text-to-speech app

We designed Spoken to give families, caregivers, and speech therapists the most efficient and easy rehabilitation tool possible. It utilizes state-of-the-art machine learning predictions and next-generation text-to-speech to help people who have trouble communicating - aphasia, autism, cerebral palsy, ALS, Parkinson‚Äôs, stroke, and more. Whether you're recovering from a ventilator or need a permanent AAC solution, Spoken is there for you.


‚Ä¢  Subscriptions

Spoken is free to use, but requires a subscription to enable additional functionality. Subscriptions are available monthly or yearly and renew automatically each month or year, unless cancelled.

recentChanges:
New and better icons for thousands of words!

We've expanded our massive icon library to support even more words, from "college" to "coronavirus"..
comments: I love this app and the options, exactly what I was looking for, but I only give it 3 stars because it requires a subscription. I cannot afford to use a device that has a subscription. If it was free, I would give it 5 stars. I want to be able to save my phrases for free. I'll have to uninstal and see if I can find a free AAC app. Edit: I recieved an email from the developer and was able to recieve a free year subscription so that I can use the apps for what I need, very helpful!
Unfortunately, doesn't support Black Shark or Redmi devices. Asks to download separate Google software which is already installed.
Predictive choices work well, and the voices sound very pleasant and natural. Would reccomend for someone with aphasia.
Interface is easy to understand and easy to use. I'm going to have my mom try using it.
I'm looking to get this for a friend who can't be understood by anyone due to degenerative ataxia but also can't pay 100 bucks, would be grateful for anything you can do!

title: Speech Therapy Delhi
description: Speech Therapy Centre was established in the year 1994 under the guidance of our founder and mentor Mr. A.P. Singh. We have given speech therapy to numerous cases ranging from mild to severe degree of stammering/stuttering. We have also given therapy to misarticulation , cluttering and other speech disorders. We have cases from all over world and were first to give online speech therapy to various cases from Canada, USA, AUSTRALIA,QATAR ,AFGHANISTAN etc. It has been constant endeavor to use best available techniques of speech therapy. We have been invited to various national and local television shows, like twice in Zindagi Live on IBN7, ZEE TV and other print and electronic media. We are the only Speech Therapy Centre in world to webcast all our group discussions and public speaking every Saturday on our website.

We have been invited to various national and local television shows, like twice in Zindagi Live on IBN7, ZEE TV and other print and electronic media. We are the only Speech Therapy Centre in world to webcast all our group discussions and public speaking every Saturday on our website.
summary: Speech therapy is an intervention service that focuses on improving ones speech.

title: e-Dictate - Speech To Text & Translator
description:
e-Dictate is a free app that converts speech into text and translates dictation into almost every language in the world, saves the text and sends it via e-mail, SMS, or other messaging applications, as well as social networks. The most reliable and precise application that turns your voice into text without interruption and which is specifically adapted for all the speech areas in the world. 

Translator will help you translate dictation into almost every language in the world !!!

Do you want to travel to another country and you don't know the language? Do you translate recorded voice - speech (dictation) and do not know what each word means?
This application is perfect to translate dictate fast in your smart device. 

With this e-Dictate Translator you won't have communication problems.

If you want to share translations with your friends, you can easily upload them directly to email, as text messages, or other messaging apps, as well as social networks, or any other application you have installed on your mobile device.

Everywhere, anytime !!!  

Designed for bloggers, writers, drivers, runners, business and young people, people with low vision who find it hard to find letters on the keyboard and those who prefer quick and easy typing. e-Dictate has a wide use, in all situations, as a replacement for the keyboard of your smartphone or computer. The application can be treated as a stenographer for business purposes, for the preparation of documents, writing ie. dictating blogs, SMS messages, reminders and any long and short textual content. Also, it is interesting to note that you can convert recorded audio files from your meetings, or from the Internet, into the text, and thus ease your work in terms of making reminders, statements, etc. A special role of e-Dictate can be in the safety of traffic participants, because typing messages with this application is a past.  

Make your life easier - do not bother to write short or long texts. 

Unlike other voice-over applications, e-Dictate does not stop listening when you take a break to breathe or think. Includes an integrated keyboard so you can enjoy ease of dictating words and ease of touching for punctuation and symbols. The e-Dictate is designed to make writing fast and easy. 

What can e-Dictate do: 

 - Write short or long texts. Some of our users dictate hands free for hours! Unlike other applications, where you must re-click the long dictation microphone, e-Dictate will not stop listening to your voice even when you make longer breaks between sentences. 
- The percentage of the success rate (accuracy) of converted speech in the text is higher than 90%, this clearly shows the quality of the e-Dictate application. 
- Quick, easy and with ease. The work environment, the interface is completely simplified and customized to users. Great for plain textual notes, because it's a super simple and reliable voice notepad.  
- Copy, share, export and print with one click.  
- Automatic capitalization and distance.  
- Editing text while still in dictation mode - there is no need to stop and restart.  
- Simultaneous voice typing with keyboard for punctuation.  
- Small size. The application is only 10MB.  
- Keeps the phone alert when it is dictated so that you can focus on your thoughts.  
- Excellent for standard texts, phrases, addresses, e-mails, greetings, professional hard terms, which you use a lot. Instead of re-typing them every time, only one touch is enough!!!  

FULL PRIVACY WHILE USING THIS APPLICATION.

Although tested, the product is as such, licensed for use - FREE.

Use is at your own risk and you can not sue us for anything regarding this application.  

ENJOY IN YOUR DICTATIONS!!!

title: Speech Therapy: K
description:
Speech Therapy: K

Does your child have trouble saying K? We can help!

How This App Works:
Speech Therapy: K is an all inclusive app that teaches you how to say K and then how to teach and cue your child how to say the sound. We will then walk you through how to systematically practice K in the comfort of your own home. We provide all the materials you will need and game ideas for every level of practice. There is also a bonus section of photo flashcards that you can bring up on your device for a quick practice.

This app is VERY different than any other app on the market made for speech therapy practice at home. 

I was tired of children with articulation needs NOT making progress! I took a good, long look at the materials available for parents. While shiny cards and fancy apps look fun, they are NOT what children need. Articulation practice should be natural, happen throughout the day, and occur with common words that your child frequently says. 

So, I created this not so fancy app to help parents reach their goals! 

In order for your child to make progress with articulation goals, he/she needs to be able to say the desired sounds within words and then practice that skill in a functional setting such as at home using words he/she actually says! For example, a child may say K correctly in the word "cave" while playing a game; however, he/she most likely won't say that word again for weeks or months. Not really functional.....

On the other hand, if a child practices K by saying "kick" while playing soccer, carryover of progress is likely to happen!

This articulation app is created with this philosophy in mind. It will take a bit more work for parents, but it will pay off in the end!

What's Included:
~Explanation on how to say K
~Tips on how to teach K to your child
~A video showing exactly how to say K and explaining common errors
~A variety of cues for helping your child say K correctly
~Word lists
~Picture Flashcards
~Practice ideas at the word and sentence level
~Online K flashcards

What you can expect:
This app is a tutorial plus practice ideas. You can expect to do a bit of learning and then carve out a few minutes each day to practice with your child. It only takes a few minutes, seriously! 

Who should use this app:
~Motivated parents whose children are having difficulty saying K
~Children who are already in speech therapy and need to work on carryover
~Children who have been working on K for a long time!
~Children who don't qualify for speech services for K even though they have trouble saying the sound!
~Speech language pathologist who want word lists, teaching techniques, and flashcards at their fingertips

Who made this app:
This app was created by a practicing, speech language pathologist. She understands how much practice is needed for articulation (speech) therapy and parents really have all the power to make the biggest difference. However, parents don't always have access to everything they need. Speech therapy can also be expensive and this is frustrating for everyone!! To reach more families, she made this app for a VERY affordable price so everyone can get learning today. 

Enjoy!

This app is a supplemental, home program. If you have concerns about your child, we recommend a consultation by a speech language pathologist before beginning any home program.

title: Speech Pathology App 1
description:
Helping Your Child With Speech Development


Speech and language skills develop at varying rates for children. Still, there are certain milestones most children reach at specific ages.



Common, everyday interaction between children and those around them is the best way to boost and enhance speech and language skills.



From birth, hearing is critical for children to learn and react to the world around them. An unidentified hearing loss can cause a delay in speech and language development. Consequently, it is better to identify and treat hearing loss as soon as possible.¬†



Parents and other caregivers can do many things to encourage speech and language development and provide learning opportunities.



Some examples:

‚Ä¢ Listen and respond to your child. Acknowledge, encourage, and praise attempts to communicate.



‚Ä¢ Talk to your child about what you are doing, what you see, what your child is doing, and what your child sees. Use language that is appropriate for your child‚Äôs speech and language abilities.



‚Ä¢ Accept mistakes as your child‚Äôs speech develops. Simply repeat or expand what was said, using the correct words or sounds.¬†



‚Ä¢ If you don‚Äôt understand what your child is saying, ask your child to repeat or help your child to rephrase.



Seek help if you suspect your child is having a speech, language, or hearing problem. An evaluation can determine whether or not a child‚Äôs skills are developing normally.



Certified speech-language pathologists and audiologists are educated and trained at the master‚Äôs or doctoral level to evaluate communication skills and treat disorders.



The steps you take can be very important. During the first five years of life, the building blocks for lifelong communication are formed. Believing your child will ‚Äúgrow out of a problem‚Äù can hinder his or her ability to read, write, learn, and engage in social relationships.
